result.execSummary:
The defendant Zina R Wakefield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid $50.00 per month commencing 07/22/22 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Letter dated 6/1/22 from Department of Health and Human Services
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:23 AM Defendant Zina R Wakefield in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached an agreement.
State filed an amended information.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 316.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $ 50.00 per month commencing 7/22/22.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:19 AM Defendant Zina R Wakefield in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Zina R Wakefield in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. No corporal or physical punishment of a child.

09:02 AM Defendant Zina R Wakefield in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  SPD needs more information about the Defendant's suspension from work before they can qualifier her. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Lau.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
